snippet.description: Anatoxin-a is also known as Very Fast Death Factor. it is found in some forms of cyanobacteria (better known as blue green algae). More videos at http://www.periodicvideos.com/
snippet.title: Very Fast Death Factor - Periodic Table of Videos

snippet.description: We create a so-called chemical garden, and discuss what happened when they did the same thing in space. More chemistry at http://www.periodicvideos.com/

snippet.description: In this video about aspirin we show you an old sample and make a new one.

Nitroglycerine, TNT and dynamite.

More chemistry at http://www.periodicvideos.com/

snippet.description:
A bit about the history and naming of this famous insecticide.

More chemistry at http://www.periodicvideos.com/
snippet.title: DDT - Periodic Table of Videos

snippet.description:
A rhombus-shaped molecule is discovered by scientists. It is Tetrasilacyclobutadiene. The work was published in the journal Science.

More chemistry at http://www.periodicvideos.com/
snippet.title: The Tetrasilacyclobutadiene Rhombus - Periodic Table of Videos

snippet.description:
Would you buy a hard drive containing uranium? One of our team has made a significant breakthrough involving a uranium compound which acts as a molecular magnet.

More chemistry videos at http://www.periodicvideos.com/
snippet.title: Magnetic Uranium - Periodic Table of Videos

snippet.description:
Video about alcohol, particular focus on ethanol which is found in alcoholic drinks. We also show distillation.

Want to do us a favour? Here's a chance to support charity and give something back to someone who helped us... http://periodicvideos.blogspot.com/2011/04/our-mystery-supporters-big-adventure.html

All our videos at http://www.periodicvideos.com/

snippet.title: Losing fingers to chemistry - Periodic Table of Videos

snippet.description:
Guy Fawkes Night in the UK is a time for bonfires and fireworks. Here's some "death mix" to shed light on things.

Check out Destin's bonfire film at http://youtu.be/w-s3NTuw-To - it's worth a look.

Zirconium video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gNJE2MPktvg
Strontium video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d5ztPGrsgNQ
Barium video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9srJdQU3NOo
Flame test video (bottled oxygen): http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O3ZuimXdObE

More chemistry at http://www.periodicvideos.com/
Follow us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/periodicvideos
And on Twitter at http://twitter.com/periodicvideos
From the School of Chemistry at The University of Nottingham: http://www.nottingham.ac.uk/chemistry/index.aspx

Periodic Videos films are by video journalist Brady Haran: http://www.bradyharan.com/

Brady's other channels include:
http://www.youtube.com/sixtysymbols (Physics and astronomy)
http://www.youtube.com/numberphile (Numbers and maths)
http://www.youtube.com/DeepSkyVideos (Space stuff)
